metadata.title: CVE-2024-10464 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Repeated writes to history interface attributes could have been used tocause a Denial of Service condition in the browser. This was addressed byintroducing rate-limiting to this API. This vulnerability affects Firefox <132, Firefox ESR < 128.4, Thunderbird < 128.4, and Thunderbird < 132.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-10464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 132.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 132.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 132.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '132.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
